revised_title: A Study of Meiotic Phenomena in Lettuce (Lactuca sativa)
tldr: This study examines meiotic phenomena in the pollen mother-cells and tapetum of lettuce, focusing on the variety and rogue of a specific lettuce plant. The author discusses the various conditions in the tapetum, the process of synapsis, and the significance of chromatin extrusion, or cytomyxis, in the development of pollen. Additionally, the article describes the phenomenon of chiasmatypy, the physical basis of crossing-over phenomena in heredity, for the first time in plants.
